Posts.Content: I've found M&S post surgery bras the most comfortable for day wear. They do a lovely twin pack of one black and one teal. For nightwear I sleep in a padded crop top that I already had from New Look sports section. I was given a bra from hospital (private rather than NHS) which fastens at the front. Make is Amoena style Frances. I still use this at night alternating with the crop top. It was really good for for few weeks post lumpectomy when arm movement a bit limited. It is suitable to use post mastectomy too as it has pockets for silicon inserts.  I'm 5 weeks post surgery and still find I need to wear something to sleep in as breast feels too sensitive directly against pjs. Good luck with your operation. Pam x

Posts.Content: I had my last T part of chemo last Wed so still getting through this last cycle. I too had very little side effects from FEC and was worried what T would bring as heard a lot about the T Truck hitting. I have to say it hasn't been too bad. I'm getting aching limbs from day 3 or 4 but helped with Gabapentin painkillers which are good for controlling the nerve pain. I just had to adjust when to take them to get the best night sleep. Nothing worse than nerve pain in night and then cant get back off to sleep. Hot baths also help.  So don't worry you can cope with T cycles too. Good luck for Wed #Aspen.  Pam x
